author: Special Correspondent
text:
It was a tense Wednesday morning at Malleswaram when passers-by noticed a 25-year-old man attempting to jump from the terrace of a five-storey private hospital.

The first-floor parapet broke his fall, which probably saved his life, said the police.

Shocked

Even as locals watched in shock, the police arrived on the scene, and with the help of the Fire and Emergency Services Personnel were able save the man and shifted him to KC General Hospital.

The victim has been identified as Vinay who claimed to be a driver and a resident of Attibele. “

He told us that he was suffering from depression because he was being harassed by his in-laws,” said the police.

Parapet wall

Around 11.20 a.m., a few passers-by noticed Vinay sitting on the edge of the parapet wall of the terrace and alerted the police.

When he saw the crowd below, he threatened to jump from the building, according to eye-witness reports.

Efforts are on to ascertain the exact reason behind the extreme step, added the police.
title: Man injured after jumping from building
